data.title: Visualizing Differences of DTI Fiber Models Using 2D Normalized Embeddings
data.authors: Haidong Chen;Honghui Mei;Zhen Liu;Senxiang Yan;Wei Chen
data.affiliation:
Chen, HD (Corresponding Author), Zhejiang Univ, Hangzhou, Zhejiang, Peoples R China.
Chen, Haidong; Mei, Honghui; Chen, Wei, Zhejiang Univ, Hangzhou, Zhejiang, Peoples R China.
Liu, Zhen, Hangzhou Dianzi Univ, Hangzhou, Zhejiang, Peoples R China.
Yan, Senxiang, Zhejiang Univ, Affiliated Hosp 1, Hangzhou, Zhejiang, Peoples R China.
data.abstract: Illustrating the differences between DTI fiber models is important for the purposes of group comparison, atlas construction, and uncertainty analysis. Standard approaches show difference between DTI models in 3D space, with either voxel-based or fiber based comparison. We proposes a new method that embeds a high-dimensional 3D fiber model as a continuous map in a 2D normalized space, built on fibers from all targeted fiber models. One advantage over previous 2D embedding approaches is that our method represents all fiber models in a unified coordinate system by taking a cluster-andproject routine, ensuring that closely located fibers from different models will be projected to close points on the 2D map. Using this projected 2D map, subtle differences that are difficult to distinguish in 3D space can be clearly displayed and individual fiber model can be effectively summarized. We applied our method to group comparison and analysis of various fiber models.
data.keywords: J.3 {[}Computer Applications]: Life and Medical Sciences; Life Cycle
